name: Aggron
flavorText: You can tell its age by the length of its iron horns. It claims an entire mountain as its territory.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Aggron by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Altaria
flavorText: It flies gracefully through the sky. Its melodic humming makes you feel like you're in a dream.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Celebi
flavorText: This Pokémon wanders across time. Grass and trees flourish in the forests in which it has appeared.
Attack1Text: Look at the top 5 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Drapion
flavorText: It attacks people and Pokémon that cross the desert. This has only furthered its bad reputation.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

name: Mamoswine
flavorText: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Nidoking
flavorText: Its tail is thick and powerful. If it binds an enemy, it can render the victim helpless quite easily.
Ability1Text: Nidoking gets +20 HP for each Nidoqueen you have in play.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Porygon-Z
flavorText: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error…
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck. This power can't be used if Porygon-Z is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: If Porygon-Z has no Rainbow Energy attached to it, Porygon-Z does 20 damage to itself and Porygon-Z is now Confused.

name: Rapidash
flavorText: At full gallop, its four hooves barely touch the ground because it moves so incredibly fast.
Ability1Text: Rapidash can't be Confused.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Solrock
flavorText: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.
Ability1Text: If you have Lunatone in play, damage counters can't be removed from any Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Damage counters can still be moved.)
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Spiritomb
flavorText: It was formed by uniting 108 spirits. It has been bound to the Odd Keystone to keep it from doing any mischief.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Spiritomb from your hand onto your Bench, you may use this power. Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws 6 cards.
Attack1Text: Choose Grass Fire Water Lightning Psychic Fighting Darkness Metal or Colorless type. Put 1 damage counter on each Pokémon your opponent has in play of the type you chose.

name: Venomoth
flavorText: The powder on its wings is poisonous if it is dark in hue. If it is light in hue, it causes paralysis.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, your Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Venomoth is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Victreebel
flavorText: Acid that has dissolved many prey becomes sweeter, making it even more effective at attracting prey.
Ability1Text: As long as Victreebel is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless more.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned. Remove 3 damage counters from Victreebel.

name: Ambipom
flavorText: They live on large trees. They are said to communicate by connecting their tails to those of others.
Attack1Text: Choose 2 cards from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the cards you chose, then have your opponent shuffle those cards into his or her deck.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards from your hand, this attack does nothing.)

name: Banette
flavorText: This Pokémon developed from an abandoned doll that amassed a grudge. It is seen in dark alleys.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and put it in the Lost Zone.
Attack2Text: Count the number of cards in your opponent's hand. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Bronzong
flavorText: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for both halves of a Pokémon LEGEND, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Move an Energy card attached to Bronzong to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Carnivine
flavorText: It walks around on its tentacles in search of a tree branch where it can dangle down and ambush prey.
Attack1Text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Remove 3 damage counters from Carnivine. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Ditto
flavorText: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can't maintain its disguise.
Ability1Text: The number of Benched Pokémon your opponent can have is now 4. If your opponent has 5 Benched Pokémon, your opponent must discard 1 of them and all cards attached to it.

name: Dragonite
flavorText: This marine Pokémon has an impressive build that lets it freely fly over raging seas without trouble.
Attack1Text: Remove all Special Conditions from Dragonite.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing. If both of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Dugtrio
flavorText: Extremely powerful, they can dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin for each Fighting Energy attached to Dugtrio. This attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

name: Electivire
flavorText: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Electivire.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Elekid
flavorText: Even in the most vicious storm, this Pokémon plays happily if thunder rumbles in the sky.
Ability1Text: As long as Elekid is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Elekid by attacks.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. Elekid is now Asleep.

name: Golduck
flavorText: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.
Ability1Text: Whenever you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Golduck, remove 2 damage counters from Golduck.
Attack1Text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

name: Grumpig
flavorText: It can perform odd dance steps to influence foes. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.
Attack1Text: Your opponent can't use any Poké-Powers on his or her Pokémon during his or her next turn.
Attack2Text: Your opponent flips a coin for each of his or her Benched Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage times the number of tails. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Kricketune
flavorText: By allowing its cry to resonate in the hollow of its belly, it produces a captivating sound.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 100 more damage.

name: Lunatone
flavorText: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Lunatone does 60 damage to itself.

name: Machamp
flavorText: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
Attack1Text: You may do 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If you do, Machamp does 20 damage to itself.
Attack2Text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Fighting Energy attached to Machamp.

name: Magmortar
flavorText: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.
Attack1Text: For each Fire Energy attached to Magmortar, discard the top card from your opponent's deck. Then, flip a coin. If tail, discard all Fire Energy attached to Magmortar.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Nidoqueen
flavorText: It uses its scaly, rugged body to seal the entrance of its nest and protect its young from predators.
Attack1Text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.
Attack2Text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Pidgeot
flavorText: It spreads its beautiful wings wide to frighten its enemies. It can fly at Mach 2 speed.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the attack cost of each of the Defending Pokémon's attacks is ColorlessColorless more.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Sharpedo
flavorText: It can swim at speeds of 75 mph by jetting seawater through its body. It is the bandit of the sea.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent discards all card from his or her hand.
Attack2Text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Sharpedo.

name: Wailord
flavorText: It is the largest of all identified Pokémon. They jump as a pack to herd their prey.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, remove 3 damage counters from Wailord.
Attack2Text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Wailord. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Wailord, this attack does 50 damage plus 50 more damage.

name: Dragonair
flavorText: Its crystalline orbs appear to give this Pokémon the power to freely control the weather.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

name: Electabuzz
flavorText: Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electabuzz.

name: Electrode
flavorText: It is dangerous. If it has too much electricity and has nothing to do, it amuses itself by exploding.
Attack2Text: You may do 40 damage plus 60 more damage. If you do, discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electrode.

name: Haunter
flavorText: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
Attack1Text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

name: Kangaskhan
flavorText: If it is safe, the young gets out of the belly pouch to play. The adult keeps a close eye on the youngster.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

name: Lairon
flavorText: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.
Attack1Text: Lairon does 20 damage to itself.

name: Lickilicky
flavorText: It has space in its throat to store saliva. It can also roll up its tongue and store it in the same spot.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon for each Energy attached to Lickilicky. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Remove 2 damage counters from Lickilicky. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Luvdisc
flavorText: Its heart-shaped body makes it popular. In some places, you would give a Luvdisc to someone you love.
Attack1Text: Each player draws and reveals the top card of his or her deck.
Attack2Text: Before doing damage, remove 1 damage counter from the Defending Pokémon.

name: Machoke
flavorText: It always goes at its full power, but this very tough and durable Pokémon never gets tired.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Magby
flavorText: It is found in volcanic craters. Its body temperature is over 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit, so don't underestimate it.
Ability1Text: As long as Magby is Asleep, prevents all damage done to Magby by attacks.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned. Magby is now Asleep.

name: Magmar
flavorText: The fiery surface of its body gives off a wavering, rippling glare that is similar to the sun.
Attack1Text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards discarded in this way.

name: Magneton
flavorText: The Magnemite are united by a magnetism so powerful, it dries all moisture in its vicinity.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Marowak
flavorText: It has been seen pounding boulders with the bone it carries in order to tap out messages to others.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage plus 60 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

name: Nidorina
flavorText: It has a calm and caring nature. Because its horn grows slowly, it prefers not to fight.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Nidorino
flavorText: Quick to anger, it stabs enemies with its horn to inject a powerful poison when it becomes agitated.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Pidgeotto
flavorText: It renders its prey immobile using well-developed claws, then carries the prey more than 60 miles to its nest.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Piloswine
flavorText: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Porygon2
flavorText: Further research enhanced its abilities. Sometimes, it may exhibit motions that were not programmed.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you play Porygon2 from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Tentacruel
flavorText: In battle, it extends all 80 of its tentacles to entrap its opponent inside a poisonous net.
Attack1Text: If Tentacruel evolved from Tentacool during this turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Unown
flavorText: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown from your hand onto your Bench, remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.

name: Wailmer
flavorText: It bounces playfully like a ball. The more seawater it swallows, the higher it bounces.
Attack1Text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Weepinbell
flavorText: Even though it is filled with acid, it does not melt because it also oozes a protective fluid.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand, choose 1 card, and discard it.

name: Yanmega
flavorText: The beat of its wings is so powerful that it accidentally dislodges full-grown trees when it takes off in flight.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Switch Yanmega with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Aipom
flavorText: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.
Attack1Text: Draw cards until you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent.

name: Aron
flavorText: When it evolves, it sheds the steel carapace that covered its whole body and develops a new one.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card of your deck. Then, remove 2 damage counters from Aron.

name: Bellsprout
flavorText: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.
Attack1Text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Bellsprout does 10 damage to itself.

name: Bronzor
flavorText: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Bronzor during your opponent's next turn.

name: Carvanha
flavorText: They form packs to attack boats and rip out their hulls to sink them. They live in rivers in the jungle.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, Carvanha's Bite attack's base damage is 40.

name: Cubone
flavorText: If it is sad or lonely, the skull it wears shakes and emits a plaintive and mournful sound.
Ability1Text: Any damage done to Cubone by your opponent's attacks is reduced by 20 for each Marowak in your discard pile (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Diglett
flavorText: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Diglett during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Dratini
flavorText: This Pokémon is full of life energy. It continually sheds its skin and grows steadily larger.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Gastly
flavorText: Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
Attack1Text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

name: Illumise
flavorText: Its fragrance attracts a swarm of Volbeat, so they draw over 200 patterns in the night sky.
Attack1Text: Remove 3 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin for each Volbeat you have in play. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Kricketot
flavorText: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

name: Lickitung
flavorText: Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Machop
flavorText: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Magnemite
flavorText: The units at the sides of its body generate antigravity energy to keep it aloft in the air.
Attack1Text: Switch Magnemite with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Nidoran ♀
flavorText: Although not very combative, it will torment its foes with poison spikes if it is threatened in any way.
Attack1Text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose 1 Pokémon you find there, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Nidoran ♂
flavorText: It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. It will strike first if it senses any danger.
Attack1Text: If Nidoran ♀ is on your Bench, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Pidgey
flavorText: Common in grassy areas and forests, it is very docile and will chase off enemies by flapping up sand.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle Pidgey and all cards attached to it back into your deck.

name: Ponyta
flavorText: It is a weak runner immediately after birth. It gradually becomes faster by chasing after its parents.

name: Porygon
flavorText: A manmade Pokémon that came about as a result of research. It is programmed with only basic motions.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy attached to Porygon and remove 4 damage counters from Porygon.

name: Psyduck
flavorText: It has mystical powers but doesn't recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Shuppet
flavorText: It uses its horn to feed on envy and malice, or so it's said. It's very active at night.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Skorupi
flavorText: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Spoink
flavorText: It bounces around on its tail to keep its heart pumping. It carries a pearl from Clamperl on its head.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. Switch Spoink with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Swablu
flavorText: Its wings bring cottony clouds to mind. It grooms with springwater and loves to sit on heads.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

name: Swinub
flavorText: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.

name: Tentacool
flavorText: It drifts aimlessly in waves. Very difficult to see in water, it may not be noticed until it stings.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Venonat
flavorText: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches and eats small bugs at night that are attracted by light.
Attack1Text: Remove from Venonat the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Volbeat
flavorText: It emits light from its tail to communicate. It loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.
Attack1Text: If you don't have Illumise in play, this attack does nothing. Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

name: Voltorb
flavorText: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Voltorb does 10 damage to itself.

name: Yanma
flavorText: Its large eyes can scan 360 degrees. It looks in all directions to seek out insects as its prey.
Ability1Text: If Yanma has no Energy attached to it, Yanma's Retreat Cost is 0.

name: Absol
Ability1Text: As long as Absol is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent puts a Basic Pokémon from his or her hand onto his or her Bench, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 Pokémon from your hand and put it in the Lost Zone. (If you can't put a Pokémon in the Lost Zone, this attack does nothing.)

name: Celebi
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Celebi is your Active Pokémon, you may attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Celebi is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to Celebi by attacks from your opponent's Stage 1 or Stage 2 Pokémon.

name: Electrode
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. If you do, Electrode is Knocked Out. Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. Choose as many Energy cards as you like and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Discard the other cards. This power can't be used if Electrode is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Gengar
Ability1Text: As long as Gengar is your Active Pokémon, if any of your opponent's Pokémon would be Knocked Out, put that Pokémon in the Lost Zone instead of discarding. (Discard all cards attached to that Pokémon.)
Attack1Text: Look at your opponent's hand and choose a number of Pokémon you find there up to the number of Psychic Energy attached to Gengar. Put the Pokémon you chose in the Lost Zone.
Attack2Text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

name: Machamp
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Machamp is on your Bench, you may move all Fighting Energy attached to your Active Pokémon to Machamp. If you do, switch Machamp with your Active Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Discard a Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Does 100 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

name: Magnezone
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Put as many Energy cards attached to your Pokémon as you like in the Lost Zone. This attack does 50 damage times the number of Energy cards put in the Lost Zone in this way.

name: Mew
Ability1Text: Mew can use the attacks of all Pokémon in the Lost Zone (both yours and your opponent's). (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)
Attack1Text: Search your deck for 1 Pokémon and put it in the Lost Zone. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Yanmega
Ability1Text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, the attack cost of each of Yanmega's attacks is 0.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Darkrai & Cresselia LEGEND
Attack1Text: Choose 2 Energy attached to Darkrai & Cresselia LEGEND and put them in the Lost Zone. If any of your opponent's Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from this attack, put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone instead of discarding it.
Attack2Text: Move as many damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon as you like to any of your opponent's other Pokémon in any way you like.

name: Darkrai & Cresselia LEGEND
Attack1Text: Choose 2 Energy attached to Darkrai & Cresselia LEGEND and put them in the Lost Zone. If any of your opponent's Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from this attack, put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone instead of discarding it.
Attack2Text: Move as many damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon as you like to any of your opponent's other Pokémon in any way you like.

name: Palkia & Dialga LEGEND
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it back to your opponent's hand.
Attack2Text: Discard all Metal Energy attached to Palkia & Dialga LEGEND. Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to his or her Prize cards.

name: Palkia & Dialga LEGEND
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it back to your opponent's hand.
Attack2Text: Discard all Metal Energy attached to Palkia & Dialga LEGEND. Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to his or her Prize cards.
